PowerConfiguration

class st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfiguration
ID: number

0x0001 the ID of this cluster

NAME: str

“PowerConfiguration” the name of this cluster

attributes: st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfigurationServerAttributes or st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfigurationClientAttributes
commands: st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfigurationServerCommands or st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfigurationClientCommands
types: st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfigurationTypes
get_attribute_by_id(attr_id)

Find an attribute by id

Parameters

attr_id (number) –

get_server_command_by_id(command_id)

Find a server command by id

Parameters

command_id (number) –

get_client_command_by_id(command_id)

Find a client command by id

Parameters

command_id (number) –

configure_reporting(device, min_rep_int, max_rep_int, rep_change)

Construct a st.zigbee.ZigbeeMessageTx to configure this attribute for reporting on a device

Parameters

  • device (st.zigbee.Device) –

  • min_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the minimum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • max_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the maximum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • rep_change (st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – The amount of change of the attribute to trigger a report

Returns

containing a ConfigureReporting body

Return type

class st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfiguration.MainsAlarmMask
ID: number

0x0010 the ID of this attribute

NAME: str

“MainsAlarmMask” the name of this attribute

data_type: st.zigbee.data_types.Bitmap8

the data type of this attribute

MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_LOW: number

1

MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_HIGH: number

2

MAINS_POWER_SUPPLY_LOST: number

4

is_mains_voltage_too_low_set()
Returns

True if the value of MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_LOW is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_mains_voltage_too_low()

Set the value of the bit in the MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_LOW field to 1

unset_mains_voltage_too_low()

Set the value of the bits in the MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_LOW field to 0

is_mains_voltage_too_high_set()
Returns

True if the value of MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_HIGH is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_mains_voltage_too_high()

Set the value of the bit in the MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_HIGH field to 1

unset_mains_voltage_too_high()

Set the value of the bits in the MAINS_VOLTAGE_TOO_HIGH field to 0

is_mains_power_supply_lost_set()
Returns

True if the value of MAINS_POWER_SUPPLY_LOST is non-zero

Return type

boolean

set_mains_power_supply_lost()

Set the value of the bit in the MAINS_POWER_SUPPLY_LOST field to 1

unset_mains_power_supply_lost()

Set the value of the bits in the MAINS_POWER_SUPPLY_LOST field to 0

augment_type(base_type_obj)

Parameters

base_type_obj (st.zigbee.data_types.Bitmap8) – the base data type object to add functionality to

Construct a st.zigbee.ZigbeeMessageTx to configure this attribute for reporting on a device

Parameters

  • device (st.zigbee.Device) –

  • min_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the minimum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • max_rep_int (number or st.zigbee.data_types.Uint16) – the maximum interval allowed between reports of this attribute

  • rep_change (st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfiguration.types.BatterySize) – The amount of change of the attribute to trigger a report

Returns

containing a ConfigureReporting body

Return type

st.zigbee.ZigbeeMessageTx

write(device, value)

Write a value to this attribute on a device

Parameters

  • device (st.zigbee.Device) –

  • value (st.zigbee.zcl.clusters.PowerConfiguration.types.BatterySize) – the value to write
